millsfield:images_texts:
March
Twenty-first,
1 9 2 7
California State Highway Commission,
State Building,
San Francisco.
Gentlemen:
Attention Col. John H. Skeggs
The City and County of San Francisco has leased from
the Mills Estate a tract
of land East of the Bay Shore Highway,
opposite Lomita Park, in San Mateo County, to be used as an
817 port.
The lease
runs for three years with an option for
renewal for two additional years.
There is also a possibility
that this site will be selected as a permanent air port site.
We have made arrangements with the City of San Bruno for
a fresh water
supply, and it will be necessary
order to make
a connection with
their water system
to cross the Bay Shore
Highway, as
per the accompanying map.
We would like to secure from your Commission the right
or privilege to maintain this water
pipe in the location as
shown on the accompanying blue print.
We intend to advertise
for bids for the laying of this water pipe on Wednesday of this
week and on the following Wednesday we
will let the
contract,
so we would appreciate your early consideration and action in
this matter.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP:KH
properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco, to Colonel John H. Skeggs of California State Highway Commission, dated March 21, 1927, concerning request to install water pipeline in conjunction with lease of Mills Estate property in San Mateo County for use as airport; file copy, not signed or mailed.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
